clinical_study.brief_title: Analysis of Extraperitoneal Rectal Neoplasms Between 3D Endorectal Ultrasonography and Magnification Chromoendoscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Results of the Comparative Analysis of Invasion Depth of Extraperitoneal Rectal Neoplasms Between Three-dimensional Endorectal Ultrasonography and Magnification Chromoendoscopy

brief_summary.textblock: ERUS-3D and CMI demonstrated good diagnostic accuracy in parietal staging of rectal extraperitoneal neoplasms, however with greater efficiency of the endoscopic method. The association of studies can improve diagnostic efficacy and influence the most appropriate approach.

detailed_description.textblock: Larger lesions present less chance of deep parietal invasion. The methods show moderate agreement with each other for lesion size and distance from the anal verge and good agreement for the rectal wall percentage of involvement. Circumferential or almost circumferential lesions have a greater chance of postoperative stenosis. Patients with more advanced lesions on AP who underwent radical resections had lower overall survival.

primary_outcome.description: Patients with Stage T after procedure

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria: patients with diagnosis of mid or distal rectum neoplasms stage 1 -
Exclusion Criteria: advanced rectal cancer (stage II, III or IV)
